intro: Cerastium vulgatum f. lucens, commonly known as the shining mouse-ear cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant features dense clusters of white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, often accompanied by small, rounded leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its finely divided foliage and delicate flowers make it a notable component of woodland flora.
